runs.comm: a thick inside edge to a clumpy, leaden-footed defensive by Watson. Ball could've gone anywhere
Warner steps forward, driving to point
beautiful timing but this time he picks out cover
got him! Slightly shorter by Matthews and Warner cuts and slaps it straight into the hands of point!
shoulders arms outside off - and this one's a right old grubber. Scoots through low to the keeper
Ponting comes forward and defends with a squirt of the blade to point
flat, on middle and defended
flicked around the corner
goes for a pull but can't time it, and they scamper a single
clamps onto this, driving to mid-on
beautiful, orthodox back-foot drive! That's classical and elegant
drives to mid-off
Watson tries to pull but somehow can't connect. It begged to be smacked over midwicket but it just rushed onto him a little
flicked behind square and they set off for a single - this'll be tight, but Jayawardene's throw is wide!
goes for a cut and inside-edges it past his stumps for four! It's all a bit harum-scarum here
oh, shot. But that's a poor effort at extra cover, the ball flying through his legs
the wrong line and it's flicked off his pads, but there's a short fine-leg to prevent the single
down the leg side and Sangakkara roars an appeal, more in hope of it not being wided than a genuine shout
Watson defends to cover, coming massively forward ala Hayden
on middle-and-off, Ponting drives watchfully without power to the diving mid-off. Good, sprawling stop
lofted with ugly, caveman power over long-on. Really did smack that!
fortuitous shot. A thick outside edge flies down to third man, but good intent showed by Watson here, unsettling the young bowler
six more! Beautiful from Watson, just picking it up off his legs and timing it magnificently. Bish, bash, bosh
angled across him and Watson shaped to play before withdrawing his bat at the last moment
slower ball - 59mph - which he tried to slap through midwicket but missed
starts with a delivery much too straight. Ponting needs no second invitation, clipping it with excellent timing down to fine leg
fantastic stroke from Ponting once more. Came walking down the pitch, opened the face and cracked it square of the wicket - that bounced quite a bit, but he rode it quite perfectly. Top, top shot
mistimed over mid-on - and only just over the fielder. I thought initially he'd hit the cover off it, but he clearly hadn't
a full bunger down the leg side
outside off, Watson chips to point
tries to clip this off his legs but can't time it at all
a full toss at 86.7mph (75.34 knots, 38.76 metres-per-second), bashed back to the bowler
that's missed everything I think! The zooter hurries on, Watson didn't pick it and it flicked his pad on the way through - excellent take
short of a length and defended out to mid-off. Short mid-off, actually
short, pulled
and this one bounces, Ponting goes back and defends out to the off side
good pace, 57mph, and Ponting pushes it out cautiously to the off side
bowled him! Ponting stepped outside leg trying to smite him over cover but loses his leg stump. Looked to me like a leggie from Mendis
short of a length and nicely tucked off his hip
flatter and quicker, patted to leg
well wide of the off stump, no feet movement and Watson reaches for it, slapping it back past the bowler
down the pitch, he tries to flip him over midwicket but gets a thick inside edge to the lurking man at short fine leg. No run there
shot. Shot indeed. Down onto one knee to this quicker ball and sweeps him out of the ground. This guy is some batsman
dances down the pitch with ballerina-fast feet, flicking him to wide long-on
fuller delivery, jabs down on it
quicker ball flicked to leg
gone! Watson attempts a horrible sweep to this very full and straight delivery, and he's hit on the back pad. Poor stroke - quality bowling
defends solidly
flicked to fine leg for a single - no, they're coming back for two and the throw's accurate and hard. A direct hit would've had Clarke heading back to the dug-out, without a doubt
big shout as he went for a sweep - looks a very good shout to me, but it's not out
forced off the back foot into the covers
very, very slow! Pats it out down to third man and they get two. This pair are so fast between the wickets - watching them is a great exercise for kids in how to run
fuller delivery driven out to long-off
very slow ball again outside off, guided down to third man who wings in a very accurate throw which knocks over the bails
squeezed out to the off side
back-cut to backward point
down the pitch flicking to deep midwicket
pulled to midwicket
quicker ball which rushes onto him and he flicks it to midwicket
onto the sweep and times it well but can't find the placement
down the pitch, padding away
flicked to leg
down the leg side and wided
smashed to cover - absolutely nailed it
slower ball and he picks it, pushing it carefully to cover
faster, swinging delivery which beats the batsman's wild swing
sweetly timed but straight to a wide mid-off
flicked to leg
bowled him! Comical cricket. A slower full-toss which Haddin seemed to pick, but it dipped late on him and splattered his stumps - the off stump and middle stump both flattened
full, dug out
on middle-and-leg, defended with haste
nudged to leg - no run there!
guides this out to the off side and they finally scamper a run
quicker ball, down the pitch to defend
down the leg side and turned to short fine-leg
swung over midwicket

another one done by a slower delivery. Are you watching, England? Superb delivery on middle-and-leg which Clarke picked, but got a leading edge back to the bowler who took a great low catch with his left hand
turned to leg
another very slow ball but it's too wide this time to the left-hander
another slower ball and cripes, this was close to shattering his stumps - a thick inside edge
quicker ball and laced through the covers for four
slower nut stroked to long-off
rapped on the pads, huge shout - but it pitched outside the off stump. Just...and was a little high I think
works it to leg
the doosra squares him up, but he plays it well with late hands
short, pulled through midwicket
good, straight delivery - excellent pace, just quick enough to keep him honest
flicked to leg to end a superbly parsimonious over
nearly another wicket for Mendis! Outside off, he tried to pull it from wide of the off stump and got a bottom edge
patted back to Mendis, nearly into his hands!
a monster from David Hussey! That is huge! Down the pitch and he absolutely nailed it into the sky, over the top, for six
flicked back to the bowler
what bowling. What belief and guile from Mendis. A quicker and fuller ball to Hussey who's rapped absolutely dead in front. Too quick, too straight
comes back into the left-hander and really rushes him - that was heading onto his off stump! Just got his bat down in time
stroked to mid-off
big, big six. He didn't quite time his sweep-slog, skying it miles in the air, but it just about had the legs on it
a carving slap off the back foot
comes confidently forward onto the front foot, meeting the pitch of the ball and flicking to leg
sheesh, that is huge. A massive slog sweep - the noise of bat on ball was sweet as a nut! The timing perfect
clipped off his pads down to third man for four. Easy
short and quick, pulled with muscular power over midwicket
pushed out to the off side
that was almost a medium pacer - outside off and Johnson back-cut it for four. Top, top shot
the straightest of bats meets the straightest of deliveries
down the pitch, cracks it to long-off
half-tracker, pulled over midwicket but can't place it
another slower ball on middle-and-leg
down the leg side and very full, chipped it uppishly and is fortunate that it falls safe at midwicket. Could've flown anywhere
another attempted yorker clipped to mid-on whose throw comes in and whacks Ian Gould (umpire) on the ankle!
slow bouncer, pulled to nowhere
a full bunger wide of the off stump - Johnson didn't pick that up at all. Shakes his head as if to say "what was that?"
oh great ball! Johnson completely deceived by this slower ball and somehow doesn't lose his off stump
that. Is. Huge. Brilliant shot, getting his front foot out of the way and clobbering it wide of long-on. Ping!
tries to repeat the shot but slices it high and point swallows it with ease
slower ball, picked by Johnson who works him to long-on
bang! Terrific blow by Lee, hammering this back past the bowler for four. Heavy power
nailed it! Absolutely creamed this full toss over wide long-on. Huge, ugly power and great to watch
beaten by a slower ball, slicing it short of third man
Lee steps to leg in classical tailender fashion in an attempt to scorch this over midwicket, but top-edges it over the keeper for four
what a yorker. Oh well bowled! Very, very fast and hit the base of the leg stump which is sent cartwheeling
a little wide of the off stump - plays and misses
clipped neatly off his legs for four down to fine leg
outside edge, another one for Malinga - well caught by Sangakkara low to his right
a thick inside edge for four! Great bonus for Australia there
